00015

00024 void
00025 routing_write()
00026 {
00027         rn_machine      *m;
00028 
00029         int              i;
00030         char             dir[255];
00031 
00032         sprintf(dir, "%s/ip.rt", g_rn_logs_dir);
00033         g_ip_routing_file = fopen(dir, "w");
00034 
00035         if(!g_ip_routing_file)
00036                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Unable to create routing table file: %s", dir);
00037 
00038         printf("Creating routing table file: %s\n", dir);
00039 
00040         for(i = 0, m = g_rn_machines; i < g_rn_nmachines; m = rn_getmachine(++i))
00041         {
00042                 routing_init_ft_write(m);
00043         }
00044 }

00046 /*
00047  * Create global structures needed to read/write forwarding tables
00048  * Note: still sequential at this point, called from ip_main
00049  */
00050 void
00051 ip_routing_init()
00052 {
00053         if(!routing_read())
00054                 routing_write();
00055 }

00057 void
00058 routing_init_ft_read(ip_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00059 {
00060         rn_machine      *m = rn_getmachine(lp->id);
00061 
00062 #if IP_RT_BINARY
00063         read(fileno(g_ip_routing_file), m->ft, m->subnet->area->g_ospf_nlsa * sizeof(short));
00064 #else
00065         fpos_t           pos;
00066 
00067         tw_lpid          id;
00068 
00069         int              i;
00070 
00071         if(m->type != c_router)
00072                 return;
00073 
00074         fgetpos(g_ip_routing_file, &pos);
00075         fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%ld", &id);
00076 
00077         if(id != lp->id)
00078         {
00079                 fsetpos(g_ip_routing_file, &pos);
00080                 return;
00081 
00082                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "No forwarding table for node: %ld", lp->id);
00083         }
00084 
00085         for(i = 0; i < m->subnet->area->g_ospf_nlsa; i++)
00086                 fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%d", &m->ft[i]);
00087 #endif
00088 }
00089 
00090         /*
00091          * frontier[] - stores the index to vertices that are in the frontier. 
00092          * solution[] - boolean solution set array. 
00093          *
00094          * d[] - distance to vertices. 
00095          * previous[] - position of vertices in frontier[] array. 
00096          * f[] - boolean frontier set array. 
00097          */
00098         unsigned int    *parent;
00099         int     *frontier;
00100         int     *solution;
00101 
00102         int     *previous;
00103         int     *f;
00104         int     *d;
00105 
00106 void
00107 routing_init_ft_write(rn_machine * m)
00108 {
00109         rn_machine      *node;
00110         rn_machine      *dst;
00111         rn_link         *l;
00112         rn_link         *link;
00113 
00114         int              i, j, q, v, w;
00115         int              dist;
00116 
00117         // connection src machine gets m->conn set to dst
00118         if(-1 == m->conn)
00119                 return;
00120 
00121         if(!frontier)
00122         {
00123                 parent = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00124                 frontier = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00125                 solution = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00126 
00127                 previous = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00128                 f = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00129                 d = tw_vector_create(sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00130         }
00131 
00132         w = 0;
00133 
00134 #if VERIFY_ROUTING || 1
00135         if(m->id % 1000 == 0)
00136                 printf("\n%ld: Rebuilding routing table \n", m->id);
00137 #endif
00138 
00139         for (i = 0; i < g_rn_nmachines; i++)
00140         {
00141                 parent[i] = -1;
00142                 solution[i] = 0;
00143                 f[i] = 0;
00144 
00145                 previous[i] = -1;
00146                 d[i] = 0;
00147         }
00148 
00149         // The start vertex is part of the solutions set. 
00150         solution[m->id] = 1;
00151         d[m->id] = 0;
00152 
00153 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00154         printf("%ld: updating frontier \n", m->id);
00155 #endif
00156 
00157         // Put out set of the starting vertex into the frontier and update the
00158         // distances to vertices in the out set.  k is the index for the out set.
00159         // j is used as the size of the frontier set. 
00160         for(i = 0, j = 0; i < m->nlinks; i++)
00161         {
00162                 link = &m->link[i];
00163                 w = link->addr;
00164 
00165                 if(link->wire->type != c_router)
00166                         continue;
00167 
00168                 frontier[j] = w;
00169                 parent[w] = i;
00170                 d[w] = 1;
00171                 p[w] = j;
00172                 f[w] = 1;
00173 
00174                 j++;
00175 
00176 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00177                 printf("\tadding %d (w=%d), dist %d \n", link->addr, w, link->cost);
00178 #endif
00179         }
00180 
00181 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00182         printf("%ld: step 2 (j=%d)\n", m->id, j);
00183 #endif
00184 
00185         // At this point we are assuming that all vertices are reachable from
00186         // the starting vertex and N > 1 so that j > 0.
00187         while (j > 0)
00188         {
00189                 // Find the vertex in frontier that has minimum distance. 
00190                 v = frontier[0];
00191                 for (q = 1; q < j; q++)
00192                         if(d[frontier[q]] < d[v])
00193                                 v = frontier[q];
00194 
00195                 if(v == m->conn)
00196                         break;
00197 
00198                 // Move this vertex from the frontier to the solution set.  It's old
00199                 // position in the frontier array becomes occupied by the element
00200                 // previously at the end of the frontier.
00201 
00202                 j--;
00203 
00204                 frontier[p[v]] = frontier[j];
00205                 p[frontier[j]] = p[v];
00206                 solution[v] = 1;
00207                 f[v] = 0;
00208 
00209                 // Update distances to vertices, w, in the out set of v.
00210 
00211                 node = rn_getmachine(v);
00212 
00213 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00214                 printf("\tconsidering node: %ld \n", node->id);
00215 #endif
00216 
00217                 for(q = 0, l = node->link; q < node->nlinks; l = &node->link[++q])
00218                 {
00219                         // continue if not c_router
00220 
00221                         dst = l->wire;
00222 
00223                         // Only update if w is not already in the solution set.
00224                         if(solution[dst->id])
00225                                 continue;
00226 
00227                         // If w is in the frontier the new distance to w 
00228                         // is the minimum of its current distance and the 
00229                         // distance to w via v.
00230                         w = dst->id;
00231                         dist = d[v] + 1;
00232 
00233                         if(dist > g_rn_ttl)
00234                         {
00235                                 d[v] = 0;
00236                                 break;
00237                         }
00238 
00239                         if(f[w] == 1)
00240                         {
00241                                 if (dist < d[w])
00242                                 {
00243 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00244                                         printf("\t\tup: dist to %ld (w=%d): %d, \n", 
00245                                                 dst->id, w, dist);
00246 #endif
00247                                         parent[w] = parent[v];
00248                                         d[w] = dist;
00249                                 }
00250                         } else
00251                         {
00252 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00253                                 printf("\t\tadd: dist to %ld (%d) %d, \n", 
00254                                         dst->id, w, dist);
00255 #endif
00256 
00257                                 parent[w] = parent[v];
00258                                 frontier[j] = w;
00259 
00260                                 d[w] = dist;
00261                                 p[w] = j;
00262                                 f[w] = 1;
00263 
00264                                 j++;
00265                         }
00266                 }
00267         }
00268 
00269 #if IP_RT_BINARY
00270         write(fileno(g_ip_routing_file), m->ft, ar->g_ospf_nlsa * sizeof(short));
00271 #else
00272         fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "%ld ", m->id);
00273 
00274 #if 0
00275 1 S := empty sequence 
00276 2 u := t
00277 3 while defined previous[u]
00278 4       insert u to the beginning of S
00279 5       u := previous[u]
00280 #endif
00281 
00282         w = m->conn;
00283         while(p[w])
00284         {
00285                 //fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "%hd ", p[w]);
00286                 fprintf(stdout, "%hd ", p[w]);
00287                 w = p[w];
00288         }
00289 
00290         fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "\n");
00291 #endif
00292 }

00300 void

00311                         sprintf(dir, "%s/ip-%d-%d.rt",

00313
